data.title: Black and white on purpose: 1970 - 2017 and beyond.
data.meta_description: A list of 706 films compiled on Letterboxd, including The Penal Colony (1970), The End of the Track (1970), Miss Nhung (1970), Gelora (1970) and Bucharest Memories (1970). About this list: Movies where B&W cinematography is an aesthetic choice, after the industry standard was 100% color. Suggestions welcome! I think I'm only going to do feature-length titles, because the B&W decision is so much easier to make in non-commercial contexts. Movies that alternate between black and white and color (to separate two narrative lines or for other reasons) aren't included, though sometimes it pains me. (8/30/2019: Right now, I am tentatively beginning to include films that are less than 100% B&W, but I haven't made a final decision yet and want to give it some in-depth thought some day when I have time.) Some shorts, though: Recess (Kiarostami, 1972) Le Paysigiste/Mindscape (Jacques Drouin, 1976) Une Generation (Philippe Grandrieux, 1982) Umieranko/A Little Dying (Jan Jakub Kolski, 1984) Looking For Langston (Isaac Julien, 1989) Capitulo 66 (Raul Ruiz, 1994) 7:35 De La Mañana (Nacho Vigalondo, 2003) Die Erlkonig (Patrick Vollrath, 2003) The Letter (Sergei Loznitsa, 2013) Ang araw bago ang wakas (Lav Diaz, 2016) The Extinct Suite (Anna Malina Zemlianski, 2017) BIG THANKS to Scott Kelly, who did a lot of work on this subject that I've cannibalized. Missing from the database (among others) are a lot of Indian films as recent as 1978-79 where black and white was the technology of choice. It appears that was most common in Tamil-language and Malayalam movies. Not in database: Kankan De Ohle (O Bedi, 1970) Dhannyee Meye (A. Mukhopadyay, 1971) Ganga Sangamam (JD Thottan, 1971) Lanka Dahanam (Sasikumar, 1971) Muthassi (P. Bhaskaran, 1971) Basheera (, 1972) Chembarathi (, 1972) Khoon Pasina (, 1972) Maya (Ramu Kariat, 1972) Nrithasala (, 1972) Patola (, 1972) Qasu (, 1972) Roktako Bangla (, 1972) Sir Dhar Di Bazi (, 1972) Dharmayudham (A. Vincent, 1973) Thushara (Nanayakkara, 1973) College Girl (T. Hariharan, 1974) Asli Tay Naqli (1975, Pakistan) Kotha Kapuram (Chandra Sekhar Reddy, 1975) Majha Sajha (1975, Pakistan) Mera Babul ( 1975, Pakistan) Nawab Zada (1975, Pakistan) Pravaham (Sasikumar, 1975) Ulsavam (Sasi , 1975) Thai Vittu Sidhanam (Thirumanam, 1975) Varat (Prabhakar Manajirao Nayak, 1975) Kanavan Manaivi (Bhimsingh, 1976) Muthana Muthallavi (?, 1976) Themmadi Vellappan (T. Hariharan, 1976) Sainthadamma Sainthadu (Deveraj-Mohan, 1977) Kalpa Vriksham (Sasikumar, 1978) Kannan Oru Kai Kuzhandhai (?, 1978) Mudramothiram (Sasikumar, 1978) Nivedhyam (Sasikumar, 1978) Adukku Malli (Gopalakrishnan, 1979) Bono Basar (Sushil Roy, 1979) Brojobuli (Bose, 1979) Sukhathinte Pinnale (Joseph, 1979) El Armario (G. Corrado, Argentina, 2000) La Tela Protectora (Mahiques, 2010) Taking Tiger Mountain Revisited (Huckabee, Smith, 2019) Enganchados (Manu Ochoa, 2020) La Casa Azul (Manu Ochoa, 2022?) Suggestions under consideration: A Girl Is a Gun, Journey to Portugal, Able Danger, Where Man Returns, The Diary of Diana B., Dr. Ketel, Manila (2009),, Rage (2018), , ,Winter After Winter, Austerlitz (2016), Paradise (Andrei Konchalovsky), Dawn (Laila Pakalnina), Lišáci, Myšáci a Šibeničák, Saaphabee Logan Noir The Mist Directors Cut Mad Max: Fury Road Black & Chrome Edition Parasite, last year's Nightmare Alley and The Third Wife. Operation "Fire", Antonio Gramsci: The Days of Prison, Gelora, The Great Traveller, Annakili, The Newest City in the World, Tonkin Jasmine Flower, Keep Moving, Di Belakang Tabir, Agnimrigam, The Councillors, Room 36, Instantes de campaña, The Spring Poem Dik Trom en zijn dorpsgenoten, Dik Trom Knapt het Op Uuno Turhapuro, Professori Uuno D.G. Turhapuro, Lottovoittaja UKK Turhapuro, Häpy endkö? Eli kuinka Uuno Turhapuro sai niin kauniin ja rikkaan vaimon, Rautakauppias Uuno Turhapuro, presidentin vävy On the Trail of Blood, Golden Eagles in Meteora, The Spring Heghnar, Kingfisher (1972), Alaki Khosh, Fije që priten, The Nomads (1976), Lithophonie, Nicola, lì dove sorge il sole, A Bird Flew In (IMDb says it's in colour, but it isn't) Manthrakodi, Street Without End (1972), I Loved an Armchair, End of the Commune?, Vive La France (1970), Metráček Sagina Mahato, Annamitta Kai, O Funeral do Patrão, 50/50 (1977), Nishi Bhor, Stroke (2000), For a Fistful of Fries, Men Without Beard Figaro's Wolves -- mixed b&w/color? The Large Trampoline, Mrs. Dau, Le Temps Perdu, The Vicar Martin Cedermac, Mon enfance à Montréal, The Wolf Man (1972), Hippodrome, Driving Mum Children Only Once (1996) X Children of the Sun (2009) X Chassis (2010) X Kamera Obskura (2012) X Lukas the Strange (2013) X Who Is Bozo Texino? ????? AFTERGLOWS, Thiiird and Geology of Separation. Forbidden to Step on Clouds, Nacher Putul, Tonkin Jasmine Flower, Allein machen sie dich ein, Son, Grandson and Seeds, Mayday! May day! Mayday! Silent Shores, On the Last Verse - A Small Film About Death, Siembra, Enter Mycel, Indigo Crystal El Conde, Oceans Are the Real Continents (2023), Tatami (2023), Yana-Wara. Air: Eating, Sleeping, Waiting and Playing, Old Coaches, Magic Mirror (2013), There’s Still Tomorrow, Benvenuti in galera
data.text:
Movies where B&W cinematography is an aesthetic choice, after the industry standard was 100% color. Suggestions welcome!

I think I'm only going to do feature-length titles, because the B&W decision is so much easier to make in non-commercial contexts. Movies that alternate between black and white and color (to separate two narrative lines or for other reasons) aren't included, though sometimes it pains me. (8/30/2019: Right now, I am tentatively beginning to include films that are less than 100% B&W, but I haven't made a final decision yet and want to give it some in-depth thought some day when I have time.)

Some shorts, though:

Recess (Kiarostami, 1972)

Le Paysigiste/Mindscape (Jacques Drouin, 1976)

Une Generation (Philippe Grandrieux, 1982)

Umieranko/A Little Dying (Jan Jakub Kolski, 1984)

Looking For Langston (Isaac Julien, 1989)

Capitulo 66 (Raul Ruiz, 1994)

7:35 De La Mañana (Nacho Vigalondo, 2003)

Die Erlkonig (Patrick Vollrath, 2003)

The Letter (Sergei Loznitsa, 2013)

Ang araw bago ang wakas (Lav Diaz, 2016)

The Extinct Suite (Anna Malina Zemlianski, 2017)

BIG THANKS to Scott Kelly, who did a lot of work on this subject that I've cannibalized.

Missing from the database (among others) are a lot of Indian films as recent as 1978-79 where black and white was the technology of choice. It appears that was most common in Tamil-language and Malayalam movies.

Not in database:

Kankan De Ohle (O Bedi, 1970)

Dhannyee Meye (A. Mukhopadyay, 1971)

Ganga Sangamam (JD Thottan, 1971)

Lanka Dahanam (Sasikumar, 1971)

Suggestions under consideration:

A Girl Is a Gun,

Journey to Portugal,

Able Danger,

Where Man Returns, The Diary of Diana B.,

Dr. Ketel, Manila (2009),, Rage (2018), , ,Winter After Winter, Austerlitz (2016),

On the Trail of Blood, Golden Eagles in Meteora, The Spring Heghnar, Kingfisher (1972), Alaki Khosh, Fije që priten, The Nomads (1976), Lithophonie, Nicola, lì dove sorge il sole, A Bird Flew In (IMDb says it's in colour, but it isn't)
